software.name: Eric D. Schmid
software.subhead: Software Developer in St. Louis, MO
software.dek: I ask thoughtful questions that cut to the heart of a subject, and effortlessly distill complex information from interviews, documents and other data sources into clear and engaging narratives. My experience in journalism makes me comfortable leading professional communications with diverse stakeholders, including organizational leaders, community members, and technical experts. I'm highly organized and detail-oriented, with a proven ability to collaborate and meet deadlines while managing competing priorities across short-, medium-, and long-term projects.

projects.title: User Administration Context
projects.subhead: Web based user registration and login service
dek: • Implements Spring Security, with JWT token, CSRF cookies, REST and remote database to administer users and secure private APIs
• Frontend user context, login and registration designed in React

projects.title: www.ericdschmid.com
projects.subhead: Redesign of personal portfolio website to leverage Svelte and Tailwindcss frameworks
dek: • Features custom built components and routing to display static news content dynamically across all screen sizes
• Implements JSON and OOP principles for lightweight, scaleable, and reusable code

experiences.title: Economic Development Reporter
experiences.subhead: St. Louis Public Radio, St. Louis, MO
experiences.dek: Researches and writes stories on efforts from businesses’, governments’, nonprofits’, and others to create economic opportunity and grow the population in Greater St. Louis
subdek: • Promoted after three years of outstanding performance in previous position
• Facilitates and leads interviews with people from many backgrounds including elected officials, business executives and military leaders

experiences.title: Metro East Reporter
experiences.subhead: St. Louis Public Radio, Belleville, IL
experiences.dek: Worked remotely producing articles about Illinois communities adjacent to St. Louis
subdek: • Pioneered news coverage for 750,000 people who hadn’t been previously served
• Produced web content reaching more than 200,000 unique users annually

experiences.title: Freelance Reporter
experiences.subhead: National Public Radio, Marketplace, Science Friday
experiences.dek: Pitches, reports, and produces original news content for national platforms

experiences.title: Dow Jones News Fund Digital Media Intern
experiences.dek: Produced video content toping five million views on company website and socials

experiences.title: College Associate
experiences.subhead: Shepard Smith Reporting, Fox News Channel, New York, NY
experiences.dek: Sourced video content for a live national broadcast reaching millions of people each day

education.title: LaunchCode
education.dek: 30-week full-stack development course in JavaScript, Angular, Java, and Spring Boot
subdek: • Project experience reviewing and completing code bases to unit test specifications

education.title: Stony Brook University
education.dek: Bachelor of Arts in Journalism, Business Management Minor

awards.title: 2023 Region 5 Murrow Award & 2022 IRE Award Finalist
dek: For original and revelatory watchdog journalism exposing a 25-year coverup of toxic groundwater contamination in Springfield, Missouri.

journalism.name: Eric D. Schmid
journalism.dek: I ask thoughtful questions that cut to the heart of a subject, and effortlessly distill complex information from interviews, documents and other data sources into clear and engaging narratives. My experience in journalism makes me comfortable leading professional communications with diverse stakeholders, including organizational leaders, community members, and technical experts. I'm highly organized and detail-oriented, with a proven ability to collaborate and meet deadlines while managing competing priorities across short-, medium-, and long-term projects.

experiences.title: Contributing Reporter
experiences.subhead: The Mississippi River Basin Ag & Water Desk
experiences.dek: Produces in-depth coverage of topics related to agriculture, environment, energy, infrastructure one of the worlds largest river basins
subdek: • Articles distributed to hundreds of local, regional, and national outlets for republication reaching 100M+ people annually
• Crafts accessible and engaging narratives from multiple interviews and data sources
• Collaborates with staff across multiple organizations to deliver high-impact and multi-part reporting on complex topics including nitrogen fertilizer runoff, insurance, disaster recovery

experiences.title: Economic Development Reporter
experiences.subhead: St. Louis Public Radio, St. Louis, MO
experiences.dek: Produces high-performing articles that cover efforts by local businesses, governments, universities, and nonprofits to expand economic opportunity in the 2.8M-person St. Louis region, contributing to a platform with 4M+ annual unique users
subdek: • Promoted after three years of exceptional performance in previous role
• Leads interviews, focus groups, and professional communications that foster trust with community members, technical experts, and business and government leaders
• Manages a robust network of community contacts and a strong understanding of St. Louis to uncover stories that resonate with audiences

experiences.title: Metro East Reporter
experiences.subhead: St. Louis Public Radio, Belleville, IL
experiences.dek: Worked remotely in Belleville, IL bureau producing in-depth and revelatory reporting about suburban communities in Southwestern Illinois
subdek: • Developed and led St. Louis Public Radio's strategy to expand news coverage to 750K+ people that the organization hadn't previously targeted

experiences.title: Freelance Reporter
experiences.subhead: National Public Radio, Science Friday, Marketplace
experiences.dek: Reports and produces original news content for nationally broadcast news programs that reach 40M+ people a week including Morning Edition, All Things Considered, Marketplace
subdek: • Appears on nationally syndicated talk shows, 'Here & Now' and 'Science Friday,' to discuss investigative and enterprise reporting
